results.title: Sheffield made
results.creator_credit: John S. Green, Frank Green and Ace Films
results.brief_description: How the steelmakers of Sheffield, with their traditions of skill and craftsmanship, are producing special steels. Shows how these same traditions, backed by research and modern equipment, are meeting the demands of designers and engineers, in the aviation industry and the construction of atomic power stations.

results.title: Sheet steel for a nation
results.brief_description: Describes the process of cold reduction of sheet steel as a stage in the production of galvanised, corrugated and other types of steel sheets. This process was first intoroduced in 1955 at Port Kembla in New South Wales. Shows how in the major operation, the steel strip rolls through rollers which exert tremendous pressure in reducing the steel to the required thickness.

results.title: Sheer genius
results.creator_credit: Tim Clark, Dept of Industry, Technology and Commerce and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Quantum”.
Developed by Jim Haseloff and Wayne Gerlach of the CSIRO, “gene shears” technology offers a precise way of removing unwanted genes and viruses from plants and animals, a genetic scalpel which could revolutionise the breeding of plants, and lead to cures for cancer and AIDS. The history of this major new discovery is presented, stressing the priority now given to commercial development and protection of intellectual property through patents, against the free exchange of scientific ideas. Australian attitudes to research and development are also explored - Australian business has shown virtually no interest in developing and exploring this and other major new break-throughs in biotechnology.

results.title: Sheepdog
results.creator_credit: John Alderson and British Sccreen Service
results.brief_description: The work of a typical English dog in the wild Welsh mountains. A study of a shepherd’s workmate, his sheepdog; used to protect flocks from marauding foxes, to round up stragglers, and to rescue injured lambs or sick ewes.

results.title: Sheep: handle with care. Parts I-III
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A three part program that shows the different aspects of sheep management. Part 1 deals with Mustering, mouthing, teeth trimming, drenching and foot care. Part 2 deals wth crutching, vaccinating, lamb marking and drafting. Part 3 deals with shearing, branding, dipping and jetting
